questions.question: What is the general GST rate in Maldives?
questions.explanation: The general GST rate in Maldives is 8%. The tourism sector rate is 17% (increased from 16% to 17% from July 2025 onwards).

questions.question: Which organization manages tax collection in Maldives?
questions.explanation: MIRA (Maldives Inland Revenue Authority) is responsible for all tax collection and administration in Maldives.

questions.question: What is the GST rate for the tourism sector?
questions.explanation: The tourism sector GST rate is 17%. This was increased from 16% from July 1, 2025 onwards.

questions.question: Which of these goods is zero-rated for GST?
questions.explanation: Essential goods like rice, flour, milk, and baby products are zero-rated (0% GST) to keep them affordable.

questions.question: By which date must monthly GST returns be filed?
questions.explanation: GST returns must be filed by the 28th of the month following the taxable period. If this date falls on a public holiday, the new deadline falls in the next working day. Late filing attracts penalties!

questions.question: What happens if you file GST late?
questions.explanation: Late filing attracts penalties based on the tax amount and number of days delayed. Always file on time!

questions.question: How can you file GST returns online?
questions.explanation: File GST returns online from MIRAConnect - it's fast, secure, and available 24/7!

questions.question: What is input tax credit?
questions.explanation: Input tax is GST you pay on business purchases. You can claim it back when filing your GST return, reducing your tax bill.

questions.question: How long can you claim input tax after receiving an invoice?
questions.explanation: Input tax must be claimed within 12 months of the date of supply or invoice issuance. Don't delay!

questions.question: Can you claim input tax on GST exempt items?
questions.explanation: You cannot claim input tax on exempt supplies exempt supplies such as rent, utilities, and education!

questions.question: What must a valid tax invoice include?
questions.explanation: A valid tax invoice must include: Supplier & Customer TIN, serial number, date, description, GST rate and amount.

questions.question: What is the GST registration threshold?
questions.explanation: You must register for GST when your business turnover exceeds MVR 1,000,000 in a 12-month period.

questions.question: How can you verify a supplier's TIN?
questions.explanation: Always verify supplier TINs on GST Lookup available on the MIRA website to ensure you can claim valid input tax credits.

questions.question: What is MIRA's helpline number?
questions.explanation: Call MIRA at 1415 for GST help and support, Sunday to Thursday 8am-4pm.

questions.question: Does MIRA offer free Tax related training?
questions.explanation: MIRA offers free training sessions, available on the MIRA website!
